EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at (≈2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following connected entities:
• Input Chest at (2.5, 17.5)
• Burner Inserter at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT
• Burner Inserter at (2.5, 16.5)
• Burner Inserter at (1.5, 17.5) (direction DOWN, linked to neighbouring entities)
• Additional Chest at (1.5, 21.5)
• Assembling Machine at (1.5, 19.5)
Use-case: To receive copper plates and process them into copper cables via a chain of inserters and assembling machinery.

### Extraction Depot at (≈3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following connected entities:
• Depot Wooden Chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) serving as an isolated belt depot
• Transport Belt Segment at (4.5, 15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest
• Depot Burner Inserter at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP (positioned next to the chest)
• Extraction System Burner Inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position at (–3.5, 28.5)
• (Also noted is a chest at (–3.5, 26.5) that appears as part of the extraction interface)
Use-case: To channel extracted items from a remote source into the processing network via a multi‐segment belt connection.

### Electricity Generator at (≈–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of the following connected entities:
• Offshore Pump at (–7.5, 25.5)
• Boiler at (–5.5, 24.0)
• Steam Engine (Generator) at (–0.5, 24.5)
Use-case: To generate electrical power for the factory systems (note that connection attempts to this object caused errors).

### Smelting Facility at (≈–3.0, 19.0)
Consists of the following connected entities:
• Stone Furnace at (–3.0, 19.0) producing iron-plate output
• Stone Furnace at (–4.0, 21.0) producing copper-plate output
• Wooden Chest at (–4.5, 18.5)
• Wooden Chest at (–5.5, 21.5)
Use-case: To convert raw ores into metal plates via smelting.

### Laboratory (ID: 7106)
Consists of the following entity:
• Lab with lab_input {‘automation-science-pack’: 17}
Use-case: To conduct research and produce science packs (currently flagged with no power).

### Connectivity Networks
Consists of multiple infrastructure groups visible on the map:
• BeltGroup linking several production areas
• PipeGroups (for fluid systems 6134, 6135, 6137, 6139) connecting fluid resources
• ElectricityGroup (id 7106) with poles distributed across key positions
Use-case: To provide logistic connections and distribute power throughout the factory.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Belt Connection to Incorrect Target
 Error: “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object as a target. You need to add an inserter that inputs items into Prototype.SteamEngine and use the inserter as the target entity.”
 Tip: Before connecting a belt, verify that the designated target is a proper inserter (or similar interface) rather than a power generator such as a steam engine.

• Placement Distance Issue
 Error: “Could not place wooden-chest at (3.5, 15.5)… The target position is too far away… Move closer.”
 Tip: Ensure that the player is within the maximum allowed distance for placement by moving closer to the intended target location.

• Undefined Variable Reference
 Error: “NameError: name ‘target_chest’ is not defined… Did you mean one of these? [‘target_pos’, ‘target_place_pos’, ‘depot_chest’].”
 Tip: Double-check and correct variable names to match defined entities—confirm that the intended target (for example, ‘depot_chest’) is properly defined before use.

• Inventory Shortage for Placement
 Error: “Could not place new wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5)… No wooden_chest in inventory.”
 Tip: Verify that the required item is present in the inventory before initiating a placement operation to avoid shortages.
